item.description:
Let's meet in front of Arizona Pizza's inside entrance (it's right across from Cinemark's self-service ticket kiosk) at around 5:45-5:50 pm. *Edit to my original post: New showtimes for this week have been posted today and the start time is now 6:15 pm and it will be a 3D show (which are a little more expensive than the regular shows).

If there's interest, we could go to Arizona Pizza (or somewhere else) for discussion and food or drinks afterwards.

From Cinemark's website:
Runtime: 142 min

MPAA Rating: PG-13 for some violent images, sexual content, smoking, partying and brief language.

Starring: Leonardo DiCaprio, Tobey Maguire, Joel Edgerton, Carey Mulligan, Isla Fisher, Jason Clarke, Amitabh Bachchan, Elizabeth Debicki

Genre: Drama Romance

Director: Baz Luhrmann

Synopsis: The film follows Fitzgerald-like, would-be writer Nick Carraway as he leaves the Midwest and comes to New York City in the spring of 1922, an era of loosening morals, glittering jazz and bootleg kings. Chasing his own American Dream, Nick lands next door to a mysterious, party-giving millionaire, Jay Gatsby, and across the bay from his cousin, Daisy, and her philandering, blue-blooded husband, Tom Buchanan. It is thus that Nick is drawn into the captivating world of the super-rich, their illusions, loves and deceits. As Nick bears witness, within and without the world he inhabits, he pens a tale of impossible love, incorruptible dreams and high-octane tragedy, and holds a mirror to our own modern times and struggles.

Official movie website: http://thegreatgatsby.warnerbros.com/
item.name: The Great Gatsby
